required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunogenicity of 2-dose Inactivated COVID-19 Vaccine in Kidney Transplant Recipients
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Immunogenicity of 2-dose Inactivated COVID-19 Vaccine in Kidney Transplant Recipients: a Prospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: The severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2) has a major impact on transplant recipients, with mortality rates up to 20%. However, immunocompromised individuals have been excluded from studies of SARS-CoV-2 vaccines. In such patients, the immune response to vaccination may be blunted. To better understand the immunogenicity of SARS-CoV-2 vaccines in transplant recipients, we quantified the humoral response to SARS-CoV-2 vaccine in kidney transplant recipients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 to 6 weeks after the second injection of inactivated vaccine
primary_outcome.description: seropositive anti-COVID-19 antibody, including IgM, IgG, and IgA

arm_group.description: kidney transplant recipients receiving inactivated SARS-CoV-2 vaccine

study_pop.textblock: patients receiving kidney transplantation in West China Hospital between 01/01/2015 and 01/03/2021

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Receiving kidney transplantation in West China Hospital, Sichuan University
Exclusion Criteria:
1) History of rejection or infection over the previous 3 months; 2) receiving kidney transplantation >3 months; 3) Combined with HBV/HVC/HIV infection in the donor or recipient; 4) Malignancy history in the donor and recipient; 5) organ transplant history in the recipient.
